pullrequest.title: Workaround for ign-cmake issue with ign-transport5

content.raw: Would this imply that for everything except `utilities` we are going to use the minor version? Can somehow the utilities package built in ignition-cmake1 have something different from the package built in ignition-cmake2? \(This question remains if you release ignition-cmake3 and so on\)
content.html: Would this imply that for everything except utilities we are going to use the minor version? Can somehow the utilities package built in ignition-cmake1 have something different from the package built in ignition-cmake2? (This question remains if you release ignition-cmake3 and so on)

pullrequest.title: Workaround for ign-cmake issue with ign-transport5

content.raw:
> Would this imply that for everything except utilities we are going to use the minor version?

I'm not sure what you mean. Can you rephrase the question?

> Can somehow the utilities package built in ignition-cmake1 have something different from the package built in ignition-cmake2?

currently the ign-cmake utilities component just has a SuppressWarning.hh header file, which I don't think has changed between version 1 and 2

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/ign-cmake1/include/ignition/utilities/

Ideally we should fix ign-cmake so it doesn't get the wrong version, but in the meantime, I think this is a valid workaround
content.html:
Would this imply that for everything except utilities we are going to use the minor version?

I'm not sure what you mean. Can you rephrase the question?

Can somehow the utilities package built in ignition-cmake1 have something different from the package built in ignition-cmake2?

currently the ign-cmake utilities component just has a SuppressWarning.hh header file, which I don't think has changed between version 1 and 2

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/ign-cmake1/include/ignition/utilities/

Ideally we should fix ign-cmake so it doesn't get the wrong version, but in the meantime, I think this is a valid workaround

pullrequest.title: Workaround for ign-cmake issue with ign-transport5

content.raw:
> I'm not sure what you mean. Can you rephrase the question?

Will a target that links against `ignition-cmake1` use everything that `ignition-cmake1` provides except the `utilities` package?

> currently the ign-cmake utilities component just has a SuppressWarning.hh header file, which I don't think has changed between version 1 and 2

Yeah, I think they are the same.  

> Ideally we should fix ign-cmake so it doesn't get the wrong version, but in the meantime, I think this is a valid workaround

This was my concern. For now, this works as you said, but if you release a new version of ignition-cmake where the utilities package is totally different, we could have a potential problem. As long as this is tracked somewhere, I'm completely fine with it.
content.html:
I'm not sure what you mean. Can you rephrase the question?

Will a target that links against ignition-cmake1 use everything that ignition-cmake1 provides except the utilities package?

currently the ign-cmake utilities component just has a SuppressWarning.hh header file, which I don't think has changed between version 1 and 2

Yeah, I think they are the same.

Ideally we should fix ign-cmake so it doesn't get the wrong version, but in the meantime, I think this is a valid workaround

This was my concern. For now, this works as you said, but if you release a new version of ignition-cmake where the utilities package is totally different, we could have a potential problem. As long as this is tracked somewhere, I'm completely fine with it.

pullrequest.title: Workaround for ign-cmake issue with ign-transport5

content.raw:
> Will a target that links against `ignition-cmake1` use everything that `ignition-cmake1` provides except the `utilities` package?

the `utilities` target is actually the only one provided by `ignition-cmake`, which originally just provided cmake macros and Find modules, but we added this header file to it so it could be shared by other packages. So there isn't a way to link against `ignition-cmake1`, only against the `utilities` target itself.

> As long as this is tracked somewhere, I'm completely fine with it.

Yeah, we're tracking it in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/issues/61
content.html:
Will a target that links against ignition-cmake1 use everything that ignition-cmake1 provides except the utilities package?

the utilities target is actually the only one provided by ignition-cmake, which originally just provided cmake macros and Find modules, but we added this header file to it so it could be shared by other packages. So there isn't a way to link against ignition-cmake1, only against the utilities target itself.

As long as this is tracked somewhere, I'm completely fine with it.

Yeah, we're tracking it in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/issues/61
